docs.snippet: Arthur Clark Farlow, a retired senior vice president of the J. Walter Thompson advertising agency, died yesterday in Chicago. He was 62 years old.

docs.snippet: The hemispheric meeting of foreign ministers that begins in Buenos Aires today, as well as the proposed summit meeting of Presidents in the spring, may be saved from banality by the new plan of a Common Market for all Latin America.

docs.snippet: May potato futures reached another new low in its downhill move yesterday as the New York Mercantile Exchange had its fourth busiest day in history. The new low for the chartists to ink on their charts was $3.20 a hundred pounds, and at day's end the...
docs.lead_paragraph: May potato futures reached another new low in its downhill move yesterday as the New York Mercantile Exchange had its fourth busiest day in history. The new low for the chartists to ink on their charts was $3.20 a hundred pounds, and at day's end the contract was nudged upward to $3.21, down 13 cents a hundred pounds on the day.

headline.main: Commodities: May Potato Futures Reach Another Low in Present Downhill Move; VOLUME EXCEEDS 6,000 CONTRACTS Sugar Edges Up on Rumor Uruguay Bought 40,000 Tons at About 2c

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb.17--The United States indicated today that it would not make large, long-term financial commitments in support of Latin American economic integration  without the approval of Congress.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb.17--The United States indicated today that it would not make large, long-term financial commitments in support of Latin American economic integration without the approval of Congress.
docs.abstract: US indicates backing for Latin-Amer econ integration but refuses to make long-term fiscal commitments without Cong approval; mins illus; Costa informally discusses Argentine proposal for OAS mil-controlled defense com; US, 12 other nations firmly opposed; coms approve 17 OAS Charter amendments and Punta del Este, Uruguay, as summit conf site
